main event: A civilian witness observed a moon-shaped object that changed to a star-shape over the course of 1 hour and 35 minutes near Las Vegas, Nevada in 1964.
interesting points: The object was initially comparable to a basketball at arm's length, but diminished to the size of a pinhead by the end of the sighting.
The object had a bright glow around its perimeter at first, which diminished to a pinhead-sized white light by the end.
The object moved slowly to the northeast with left and right tracking movements.
The witness, a 25-year-old construction worker, took a photograph of the object, but it did not show up on the film.
The weather conditions at the time included clear skies overhead, partly cloudy conditions around St. George, Utah, and strong winds.
result: The sighting was concluded to be a weather balloon released by the weather station at McCarren Field, Las Vegas.
sighted object: moon-shaped object that changed to a star-shape
photographs: Yes, but the object did not appear on the film
